name: The Cowboys and Criminals of "Cowboy Bebop" Quiz / Test | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: This member of the Bebop has one artificial eye.
questions.explanation:
Spike Spiegel.

	Spike's fake eye is lighter in color than the other one. A flashback in episode six showed that his right eye was replaced with a cybernetic one.

questions.text: This character was cryogenically frozen following an accident.
questions.explanation:
Faye Valentine.

	Fay was born in 1994, and was cryogenically frozen sometime in her twenties, so in 2071 she appears to be twenty-three, although she is actually seventy-seven. Talk about looking good for your age!

questions.text: According to Spike, who sings off-key?
questions.explanation:
Faye Valentine.

	In episode five, Spike is shot in the stomach, jumps out a window and endures many other injuries. In fact, it's a wonder he's alive! Later seen in a full body cast, he is laying on a couch on the Bebop when he tells Faye that she sings off-key.

questions.text: The Three Old Men show up in various episodes. Which answer is not one of the Three Old Men?
questions.explanation:
Miguel.

	Often seen in a bar, the Three Old Men survive many shootouts and mainly act as comic relief. They are presumably named for Brazilian musician Antonio Carlos Jobim. They also appeared in the movie based on the series.

questions.text: In episode five, this character is seen using an automatic pistol. He also fought in the Titan War.
questions.explanation:
Vicious.

	Vicious' first appearance is in episode five, and he is commonly seen wielding a katana, an awkward choice in an age of rifles and handguns. His  white hair ensures nearly instant recognition among "Cowboy Bebop" fans.

questions.text: This character gathered food for the crew in the episode "Mushroom Samba".
questions.explanation:
Ed.

	Edward Wong Hau Pepelu Tivrusky IV is commonly known as "Ed" among fans and characters alike. She is a ten-year old computer hacking genius who is commonly seen in the company of Ein the dog.

questions.text: This character is the cook for the Bebop's crew.
questions.explanation:
Jet Black.

	Jet is a former policeman in his late 30's. He has a cybernetic limb to replace the one he lost in an accident, although he could have chosen to have a flesh-and-blood limb instead. He has a scar over his left eye and is bald.

questions.text: This character is seen only in flashbacks for most of the series.
questions.explanation:
Julia.

	Julia is Spike's long-lost love, and he spends much of the series looking for her. She thinks Spike is dead until she meets him again in the episode "The Real Folk Blues". She dies shortly thereafter.

questions.text: This duo advertise available bounties on their television show.
questions.explanation:
Punch and Judy.

	Punch and Judy are a reference to an old British style of puppet humor. Their information is sometimes unreliable, and for the most part the crew of the Bebop doesn't pay much attention to them.

questions.text: This character got mixed up with some bad types, but all he wanted was to pay off his sister's huge medical bills.
questions.explanation:
Roco.

	Roco was introduced in episode eight. He admired Spike's fighting skills and asked Spike to train him. Roco demonstrated the fruits of his labor by "flowing like water" and throwing his opponent to the ground shortly before he was shot to death.
